chapter.title: Event Sourcing
chapter.para: Event Sourcing is the process of using the events as primary source of information to restore the state of an aggregate. This concept allows you to use the actual source of aggregate state as your audit trail.

sect1.title: Using event sourcing support
sect1.para:
Using Event Sourcing in Axon is really easy. All you need to do is the following:
Create and implement a subclass of EventSourcingRepository and implement the abstract methods.
Configure it in your Spring application context using an EventStore. Axon provides an XStreamFileSystemEventStore for you, which needs to be configured with a source directory to store events in.
You can tweak the event storage process by implementing your own EventStore. You could, for example store events in a database.
